elements.name: csa_capstone_workshop_preamble
elements.html:
Code.org CSA Professional Learning Program Capstone: {csa_capstone_workshop}

Post-workshop Survey

Thank you for attending Code.org's '{csa_capstone_workshop}' workshop

Code.org relies on surveys as a crucial tool through which we remain connected to teachers, and to give you the opportunity to provide feedback about our curriculum and your teaching experience, as well as to improve our programs.

Privacy and Confidentiality

  • Your individual responses here are completely confidential.
  • Your identity will never be revealed publicly or used to tie any responses back to you personally.
  • We may share anonymous, aggregate data (representing all responses) publicly.
  • Your anonymized responses will be used by Code.org, our Regional Partners, and our facilitators for program improvement.

Your honesty and candor are appreciated.

elements.name: overall_success
elements.title: How much do you agree or disagree with the following statements about the workshop overall?

rows.text: I feel more prepared to teach CSA in the next school year than before I came to this workshop.
I know where to go if I need help preparing to teach CSA.
This professional development workshop was suitable for my level of experience with teaching CS.
I feel connected to a community of computer science teachers.
I would recommend this workshop to others.

elements.name: workshop_most_useful
elements.title: What content from this workshop was most useful to you?

elements.name: workshop_expected_content
elements.title: What content did you expect to be included in this workshop that wasn’t?

elements.name: csa_taught_current_sy
elements.title: Did you teach Computer Science A (CSA) during school year 2022-23?

elements.name: csa_taught_current_sy_used_cdo
elements.title: What CSA curriculum did you use more often to teach CSA during school year 2022-23?

choices.text: I used mostly Code.org's CSA curriculum
I mostly used a CSA curriculum I've developed
I mostly used a CSA curriculum developed by a provider other than Code.org

elements.name: csa_taught_enjoy
elements.title: What did you enjoy the most about teaching CSA during school year 2022-23?

elements.name: csa_taught_challenge
elements.title: What was one challenge you faced teaching CSA during school year 2022-23?

elements.name: csa_taught_difference
elements.title: What is one thing you did while teaching CSA during school year 2022-23 that “made all the difference” for you or your students?

elements.name: other_feedback_teach_csa
elements.title: Is there anything else you’d like to share about your experience teaching CSA?

elements.name: csa_strengthen_ap_cs
elements.title: What does your school need to strengthen its AP computer science program?

elements.name: java_knowledge_matrix
elements.title: How much do you agree or disagree with the following statements about your knowledge of Java?

rows.text: I have the right amount of Java knowledge to successfully teach CSA in SY 2023-24.
I would benefit from exploring resources to increase my Java knowledge.

elements.name: csa_support_preference
elements.title: When you face a challenge or have a question regarding teaching CSA, where do you go first to get support?

choices.text: Colleagues or other computer science teachers
Education platforms other than Code.org (e.g., Kahn Academy, CodeHS)

elements.name: csa_plans_next_sy
elements.title: We recognize that plans change all the time. We are interested in knowing, at this point in time, if you are planning to teach CSA next school year?

choices.text: Yes, I plan to teach CSA next school year.
No, I don't plan to teach CSA next school year.
I am not sure If I will teach CSA next school year.

elements.name: csa_plans_next_sy_reasons_no
elements.title: Please select the main reason why you won't be teaching CSA next school year.

choices.text: I will be teaching a different subject
I am moving to a new school
Our schedule changed and computer science is no longer a course
I won't be teaching any longer

elements.name: csa_plans_next_sy_reasons_no_other
elements.title: Please describe the main reason why you won't be teaching CSA next school year.

elements.name: csa_plans_next_sy_reasons_not_sure
elements.title: Please select the reasons why you don't know if you will teach CSA next school year.

choices.text: I am moving to a new school and don't know the schedule yet
I don't know the schedule yet
I don't know yet what my plans are for next school year

elements.name: csa_plans_next_sy_reasons_not_sure_other
elements.title: Please describe the main reason why you don't know if you will teach CSA next school year.

elements.name: future_workshop_preferences_header
elements.html: Your Preferences For Future CSA Professional Learning Workshops

elements.name: future_workshop_content_matrix
elements.title: How likely would you be to attend workshops on the following topics in the future?

rows.text: Exploring additional resources to strengthen Java skills.
Networking with teachers who are also teaching the curriculum.
Interacting with Code.org team members who can answer my questions.
Exploring resources to support teaching computer science.
Preparing students for the AP exam.
Using AP data to strengthen teaching practice.
Tips and tools for recruiting diverse students into CS classes.

elements.name: preference_virtual_inperson
elements.title: Are you more likely to attend a virtual or an in-person workshop?

elements.name: preference_weekdays_weekends
elements.title: Are you more likely to attend a workshop during the weekend or during weekdays?

elements.name: preference_school_year_summer
elements.title: Are you more likely to attend a workshop during the school year or during the summer?

elements.name: preference_local_national
elements.title: Are you more likely to attend a local workshop (facilitated by and for teachers from your region/state) or a nation-wide one (facilitated by and for teachers from across the country)?

elements.name: demographics_header
elements.html:
Your Background

Lastly, we'd like to know a little bit about you and your background.

elements.name: gender
elements.title: What is your gender identity?

elements.name: race
elements.title: What is your racial or ethnic identity?

choices.text: Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander

elements.name: other_feedback__workshop
elements.title: Is there any other feedback you’d like to share about your experience attending this workshop??

elements.name: can_contact
elements.title: Would you be open to code.org reaching out to you to gather additional feedback about our professional learning programs?

elements.name: permission
elements.title: I give Code.org permission to quote my written feedback from today for use on social media, promotional materials, and other communications.

choices.text: Yes, I give Code.org permission to quote me.
No, I do not give Code.org my permission.

elements.name: cdo_heart_you
elements.html: Thanks from Code.org for your time, commitment and passion for teaching CSA this year.
